data.what_is:
HighLevel is a white-label sales & marketing platform for digital agencies and consultants. Functionality includes CRM with SmartLists, Email, 2-way SMS, Consolidated SMS/Messenger/Instagram DM/Whatsapp/GMB Chat, Outbound Calling, Call Tracking, Call Recording, Power Dialer, Form Builder, Survey Builder, Funnel Builder, Website Builder, Online Scheduling, Workflow Automation, Reporting, Webhooks, and more!

Agency accounts include unlimited sub (location) accounts for your clients that can be cloned to speed up setups. Bring your own Twilio & SMTP credentials to power your account, giving you access to wholesale rates on email, phone call, and sms. 

Start with a 14 day free trial!
data.product_description: The fastest growing white-label marketing platform for digital agencies. CRM, Email, 2-way SMS, Funnel Builder, and more! Start with a 14 day free trial!

pricing_plans.plan_description: Whitelabel your account and set it to live on your own custom domain. Start with a free 14-day trial!

features.name: Customization

initial_reviews.review_title: Incredible platform!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Effective and cost effective platform bringing so many tools together...and they keep adding more! I sent my first email campaign today and appreciate the top-notch support from Key! She not only understands your goals as a marketer but has serious tech chops to troubleshoot a trigger/delivery workflow I created.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
There is a learning curve, as all platforms have, but there are limited resources to give you the exact (click this button) detailed instructions you need to set things up beyond the basic set-up training. YouTube videos are hit or miss. I wish there was a thorough, step-by-step training videos for all functions. The first 90-days of customer support is the best! And having people like Key at HighLevel  is what we need to execute successfully!

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
I've been able to elminate several subscriptions for software that is contained within HighLevel and as my familiarity grows, suspect there will be more.

initial_reviews.review_title: HighLevel is great with evolving their platform according to user requests.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I like the variety of features, the possibilites, and the "aliveness" of the platform.  What I mean is, in the year since I've been using it, there have been many improvements.  Their Changelog is very active, in addition to the Ideas board.  I've been generally pleased with their support team too.  There's quite a bit you can make happen with the tools they have on offer.  What keeps me around is knowing the platform will keep improving and that, if I'm lucky, some of the features to come will be major unlocks for problems we're trying to solve.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
I dislike a couple minor things, like how the Conversation default view is set to "Unread" rather than "All".  I disklike how email templates are not yet dynamic.  I dislike how there aren't more specific workflow actions for the Twilio phone system.

The main thing is the absence of specific features.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's really the all-in-one communication tool that customers can access on the go with the app.  Solves being able to nurture leads, and also track the source of the leads.  More accurate Return on Ad Spend (ROAS) is a major benefit of the platform, because you can connect the source of the lead with the conversion rate, so companies know what campaigns are successful or not.  The workflow automations are second to none, so almost any marketing, sales, or customer experience idea you have is possible to make a realitywith the current tools.  If it's not, the Support Team encourages users to add requests to the Ideas board, which is a living ecosystem of ways to improve HighLevel.  That's one of the core reasons I stick around, is because I know the team takes feedback into account and the platform is always evolving.  EVOLUTION, LIVING, BREATHING, ORGANISM are words I associate with HighLevel.  I would not be nearly as pleased if I didn't recognize all the improvement made in the year from 2023-2024.

initial_reviews.review_title: HighLevel: Admin Life-Saver
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
HighLevel isn't just a tool, it's a productivity party! It's helped me ditch the juggling act and transformed my admin life into a well-oiled machine. Now I have more time to focus on what matters most -  crushing tasks and supporting my team.  Highly recommend, fellow admins! This is one admin tool worth celebrating (with a virtual high five, of course).

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
Based on my experience none.
Multiple platforms? Gone! HighLevel integrates everything - emails, social media, pipelines, you name it - under one roof. It's like a one-stop shop for admin tasks, keeping everything organized and accessible.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Basically, HighLevel makes me a social media and email superhero for all 3 companies!  Increased efficiency, reduced errors, happy clients -  it's a win-win.  Highly recommend to any admin facing similar battles!

initial_reviews.review_title: Unmatched All-in-One Platform at the price point!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Oh goodness, I like that it's all-in-one and the team has a relentless drive for innovation so it's always improving. I also love that at the heart of its feature set are communication and automation which is essential for any business these days.

When you look at similar tools in the space, at similar price points, one of the key features that stands HighLevel apart is unified inbox, and particularly the use of two-way SMS. Similar platforms in the space allow for only one-way SMS, or do not touch the functionality at all.

The customer support, while backed up at times, is truly great for a company growing as fast as theirs. Just the other day I was able to jump on a zoom call with a support rep and get my question answered.

I use HighLevel daily and have shifted to building exclusively in this platform for our clients.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
If I had to choose something I dislike about the platform, it would be the fact that the "desktop" version of the platform isn't mobile-friendly. This means you are limited to the functionality in the mobile app. Other tools like systeme.io work flawlessly on all mobile devices, so you truly can run your business from anywhere (but I'm not switching just for that).

Many people are bothered by the learning curve. But I'm not. Anything worth mastering takes time and attention.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
HighLevel solves the problem of having to duct tape a bunch of tools together or rely on 3rd party tools to combine all your data and information. It's one place for everything.

initial_reviews.review_title: Every minute not using GHL is costing you time and money!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
After DECADES of patching tools together I have finally found a tool that does it all. Seriously. Everything a small business needs from a website to texting to making appointments to collecting monday to gathering company reviews. All in a single software package. As an agency owner, convincing my clients to use GHL is very easy. They save money on several subscriptions. And they can spend more time working ON their business not IN (the tech) of their business. Note: I've been at this game since 1998. There isn't a CRM I havent used so I have high bar to be impressed. GHL has flown over that bar, done a back handspring and stuck the landing. Way to go!

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
This isn't a dislike but more of a reminder that comes with all software. There are a lot of features in there. If you try to use every feature or jump on every change they release (and they release a lot of changes) you are going to get overwhelm and frustrated. Focus on the 2-3 minimum features you need to get revenue flowing in your business. Then dip into the other features little by little.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an agency this is very easy solution to deploy. I can create model CRM snapshots and easy replicate them as we onboard each client. Plus it's very easy to get a new instance up and running if I'm on the phone with a new client that just paid. It's built for agencies.

initial_reviews.review_title: The Operating System...That All Agency's, Digital Creatives, and Small Businesses need!
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I've been an entreprenuer since 1999, and was an early adopter of implementing online booking for my hair salon, about 20 years ago.

It's not common that hairstyling and stacking software for professions live in the same space.   However, my business road lead me down the path of utilizing several software platforms to automate many of my business tasks before automation was a "thing".

What I can share with you is that, over the years...with one salon software company, as a small business I had spent $10,000+ on seperate software modules, and only in the end left them because they always promised upgrades, but the upgrades would never come.

My use of High Level are many.   I use it for both of my family "mom & pop" businesses.   Salon & an Auto Repair Garage.

Next, I am a business consultant and Coach...and HighLevel has, in my professional opinion, everything you would need as a coach because you can build courses & even build a community.

After using HighLevel for about 6 months, I did cancel ever other software that I was previously using.  This did have a nice financial year benefit to cutting down on costs.

I'd have to say that my favorite things about the platform are:

>The speed in which they build or improve features
>They have weekly zoom meetings for what's going on with internal product launches
>Support - They offer chat, or live Zoom support

And by far, my favorite thing yet has been attending their LIVE EVENTS.    They are about EDUCATION, and not PITCHING.   The owners are at the events and are so down to earth.

And the Facebook Community is just a deep well of like-minded people.


I've experienced my annual costs paying for themselves rather quickly within my own salon business, because, if I had to suggest which would be my FAVORITE solution/feature it would be the Missed Call Textback.    I have peace of mind, knowing that if I miss a call, then the easy to set up automation, will send a text back to the potential new customer.


Basically, in a nutshell, I'm a professional that uses Highlevel on every level.    In my business and as a business.

What you can digitally do with HighLevel is only limited to your imagination.

The value for the price really doesn't seem equally matched for all that they provide, but I'm glad they do.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
Only once in awhile a ticket gets handled by too many support reps, inside the ticket system,  but I haven't ever experienced HighLevel not getting to the bottom of things.

And the other thing I dislike is...not finding HighLevel sooner!

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Saves my business time, and has helped to improve my customer's experience.

all_reviews.review_title: HighLevel is great with evolving their platform according to user requests.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I like the variety of features, the possibilites, and the "aliveness" of the platform.  What I mean is, in the year since I've been using it, there have been many improvements.  Their Changelog is very active, in addition to the Ideas board.  I've been generally pleased with their support team too.  There's quite a bit you can make happen with the tools they have on offer.  What keeps me around is knowing the platform will keep improving and that, if I'm lucky, some of the features to come will be major unlocks for problems we're trying to solve.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
I dislike a couple minor things, like how the Conversation default view is set to "Unread" rather than "All".  I disklike how email templates are not yet dynamic.  I dislike how there aren't more specific workflow actions for the Twilio phone system.

The main thing is the absence of specific features.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
It's really the all-in-one communication tool that customers can access on the go with the app.  Solves being able to nurture leads, and also track the source of the leads.  More accurate Return on Ad Spend (ROAS) is a major benefit of the platform, because you can connect the source of the lead with the conversion rate, so companies know what campaigns are successful or not.  The workflow automations are second to none, so almost any marketing, sales, or customer experience idea you have is possible to make a realitywith the current tools.  If it's not, the Support Team encourages users to add requests to the Ideas board, which is a living ecosystem of ways to improve HighLevel.  That's one of the core reasons I stick around, is because I know the team takes feedback into account and the platform is always evolving.  EVOLUTION, LIVING, BREATHING, ORGANISM are words I associate with HighLevel.  I would not be nearly as pleased if I didn't recognize all the improvement made in the year from 2023-2024.

all_reviews.review_title: Unmatched All-in-One Platform at the price point!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Oh goodness, I like that it's all-in-one and the team has a relentless drive for innovation so it's always improving. I also love that at the heart of its feature set are communication and automation which is essential for any business these days.

When you look at similar tools in the space, at similar price points, one of the key features that stands HighLevel apart is unified inbox, and particularly the use of two-way SMS. Similar platforms in the space allow for only one-way SMS, or do not touch the functionality at all.

The customer support, while backed up at times, is truly great for a company growing as fast as theirs. Just the other day I was able to jump on a zoom call with a support rep and get my question answered.

I use HighLevel daily and have shifted to building exclusively in this platform for our clients.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
If I had to choose something I dislike about the platform, it would be the fact that the "desktop" version of the platform isn't mobile-friendly. This means you are limited to the functionality in the mobile app. Other tools like systeme.io work flawlessly on all mobile devices, so you truly can run your business from anywhere (but I'm not switching just for that).

Many people are bothered by the learning curve. But I'm not. Anything worth mastering takes time and attention.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
HighLevel solves the problem of having to duct tape a bunch of tools together or rely on 3rd party tools to combine all your data and information. It's one place for everything.

all_reviews.review_title: Every minute not using GHL is costing you time and money!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
After DECADES of patching tools together I have finally found a tool that does it all. Seriously. Everything a small business needs from a website to texting to making appointments to collecting monday to gathering company reviews. All in a single software package. As an agency owner, convincing my clients to use GHL is very easy. They save money on several subscriptions. And they can spend more time working ON their business not IN (the tech) of their business. Note: I've been at this game since 1998. There isn't a CRM I havent used so I have high bar to be impressed. GHL has flown over that bar, done a back handspring and stuck the landing. Way to go!

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
This isn't a dislike but more of a reminder that comes with all software. There are a lot of features in there. If you try to use every feature or jump on every change they release (and they release a lot of changes) you are going to get overwhelm and frustrated. Focus on the 2-3 minimum features you need to get revenue flowing in your business. Then dip into the other features little by little.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
As an agency this is very easy solution to deploy. I can create model CRM snapshots and easy replicate them as we onboard each client. Plus it's very easy to get a new instance up and running if I'm on the phone with a new client that just paid. It's built for agencies.

all_reviews.review_title: The Operating System...That All Agency's, Digital Creatives, and Small Businesses need!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I've been an entreprenuer since 1999, and was an early adopter of implementing online booking for my hair salon, about 20 years ago.

It's not common that hairstyling and stacking software for professions live in the same space.   However, my business road lead me down the path of utilizing several software platforms to automate many of my business tasks before automation was a "thing".

What I can share with you is that, over the years...with one salon software company, as a small business I had spent $10,000+ on seperate software modules, and only in the end left them because they always promised upgrades, but the upgrades would never come.

My use of High Level are many.   I use it for both of my family "mom & pop" businesses.   Salon & an Auto Repair Garage.

Next, I am a business consultant and Coach...and HighLevel has, in my professional opinion, everything you would need as a coach because you can build courses & even build a community.

After using HighLevel for about 6 months, I did cancel ever other software that I was previously using.  This did have a nice financial year benefit to cutting down on costs.

I'd have to say that my favorite things about the platform are:

>The speed in which they build or improve features
>They have weekly zoom meetings for what's going on with internal product launches
>Support - They offer chat, or live Zoom support

And by far, my favorite thing yet has been attending their LIVE EVENTS.    They are about EDUCATION, and not PITCHING.   The owners are at the events and are so down to earth.

And the Facebook Community is just a deep well of like-minded people.


I've experienced my annual costs paying for themselves rather quickly within my own salon business, because, if I had to suggest which would be my FAVORITE solution/feature it would be the Missed Call Textback. After using HighLevel for about 6 months, I did cancel ever other software that I was previously using.  This did have a nice financial year benefit to cutting down on costs.

I'd have to say that my favorite things about the platform are:

>The speed in which they build or improve features
>They have weekly zoom meetings for what's going on with internal product launches

The structure of the affiliate program and incredible eco-sys that revolves around HighLevel is incredibly valuable. Not just a software, HighLevel is an economic engine.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
HighLevel has a minimum viable product approach to launching new features but lacks an internal audit and continuous product improvement process. This results in rapid rollout of great new features which lack basic and reasonable core functionality; the delays in getting those upgades and updates is often unreasonably exessive.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Without HighLevel I would be using gmail for follow up/follow through and nurturing emails and Meta Business Manager as my social media planner.

all_reviews.review_title: Lots to Learn and Lots to Benefit
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
The amount of functions and how they all integrate is what I like best about High Level. Having so much in one place is both a blessing and a curse! And it's about learning the features and then handing off a lot of the busy work part of it to an assistant to handle the daily management.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
It doesn't always feel intuitive, with multiple lays of clicks to ultimately reach the page that has the controls for a function that seems like it needs to be more easily accessible.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralizing numerous functions is the greatest benefit above all else. As the software becomes more familiar, like many things in life, it becomes easier to use. I feel strongly that I need to learn the basics before I can hand those functions off to a staff member who has been thoroughly trained in using this platform to its most complete capacity.

all_reviews.review_content:

It has all the tools and features a business needs for marketing and sales operations. It even has a native integration to Facebook Forms, when other CRM solutions usually require a 3rd party middle man like Zapier to integrate. Reports from Google Ads and Facebooks can be displayed in the CRM

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
They are always releasing new features, but sometimes they do it so fast that they miss some glitches in the interface. The end-user can experience bugs using that new feature for a couple of weeks after it's released.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Centralized solution for the sales team to receive leads, manage communication, and close clients. The marketing team uses it to send email blasts, SMS marketing, and even social media posts (replaces Hootsuite). Now we are even using their new AI feature to generate content for the emails and social media posts.

all_reviews.review_title: Wow, HighLevel has been life-changing for our agency.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I love the ability to eliminate other online marketing and management software programs. We have personally eliminated 8 other software programs by implementing HighLevel for our agency.

We also love the agency pricing model and the insane (good) community involvement and support by the founders and the whole team.

I have used a LOT of software in my agency career, and the sheer pace of development to both improve existing features and bring more features under one software roof is like nothing I've ever experienced before from other software partners. Not. Even. Close.

HighLevel has been life-changing for our agency and our customers. Keep up the great work.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
Given the incredible pace of development and growth, sometimes the app is a little slow at various touchpoints. However, there are constant improvements and I can't imagine what goes into managing such incredible growth and adoption by thousands of agencies and their clients around the world.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
* Consolidating too many tech silos.
* SMS marketing
* Incredible marketing automation
* Easy-to-use website builder (custom values are incredibly powerful)

We've been able to steamline our new customer onboarding by at least 75% and at the same time offer a much more powerful tool than ever before.

all_reviews.review_title: Best Platform EVER - Completely Runs My Business
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Everything. I've used HighLevel for 3+ years and it's replaced ClickFunnels, ActiveCampaign, JotForm, Calendly and Kajabi for me.

I'm currently working on a client project in Kartra and it yet again reminded me how much better HighLevel is compared to everything else out there.

I also really like how they use the Ideas Board and input from its Users to determine what to add or work on next in the software.

In fact, I've never seen any other software or tech company roll out new features and enhancements as quickly as they do.

Oh - and Shaun (CEO) is amazing. He's active in the Facebook group, creates short and to the point videos multiple times a week when new features roll out.

HighLevel is just an all-around game changer and highly highly recommend.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
There's some minor things that I'd love to see added or changed around, but the HighLevel team is always working to improve the system. Overall, there are very few things I dislike about the software.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Everything. I've moved from WordPress to HighLevel for my primary website and it's so much easier to use. I've moved my funnels from ClickFunnels over to HighLevel and increased conversions and revenue. I no longer have to piece together multiple different softwares - which if you 've had to do that you know how much of a pain it is and things are always breaking.

I can now even do my billing and invoices straight from HighLevel.

Problems solved:
* Building funnels and websites
* Managing Contacts and Sales Pipeline
* Text and Email Marketing and Autoresponders

all_reviews.review_title: A platform designed to grow with your agency
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Most all-in-one tools suck. That's not the case for HighLevel.

The tool keeps it dead simple to build a suite for clients that keeps them onboard even if they stop using your agency for managed services.

The platform allows you to create playbooks and recipes that can drive more sales opportunities for your clients. The development team is always looking to expand on functionality to make this a tool that grows with you.

Additionally, I love that HighLevel let's you OWN the customer relationship. When you set a client up with other tools like HubSpot or ActiveCampaign, the tools benefit more than you do. HighLevel is letting you maintain the relationship and profit by getting more people on their platform through your white label SaaS.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
They do move quickly, and sometimes things break. Additionally, there is a huge focus on "the new" that seems to take precedent over spending time to make the good features great.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
It helps my agency find the best partners. Folks that are using HighLevel or aware of the product tend to keep their clients longer and in turn stay working with us longer.

reviewer.reviewer_job_title: Founder of FLOW-Lead Conversion System for Home Services Contractors

all_reviews.review_title: Super powerful tool for all things sales, marketing & automation related
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
HighLevel is a powerhouse of a CRM system. It has a huge variety of functionalities and is constantly improving and growing. Within the few years that I have been using it, they have rolled out comprehensive workflow features, a social media planner, website builder, and more. My favorite part is how easy it is to create, set up, and send out email/texting automations. We use HighLevel entirely for planning our webinars as well, from building the landing pages, to setting up workflows and email reminder automations, adding registrants to our pipelines, and advertising it via the social media planner. It easily integrates with Zapier so we are able to hook it up to our other platforms as well.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
There are a few features that seem like they should be obvious but that are not available as features yet. For example, the ability to embed surveys into emails, filter contacts by the exact date they were uploaded, view conversations that are still pending a response, make outbound calls, the ability to automatically detect duplicate contacts in the system, etc.. Once these little bugs are addressed, it'll be a perfect CRM.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
HighLevel solves a number of issues at our company. The biggest is that it eliminates the need for multiple expensive software. We are able to complete a bulk of our daily tasks within HighLevel and that saves us tons of time and money. It helps us with prospecting, email sending, automations, building landing pages, social media planning, pipeline management, and more!

It provides everything they need to deliver outstanding results for their clients and is priced in a way that makes it the most profitable and scalable solution on the planet. After years of using every solution, including PipeDrive, Infusionsift, Active Campaign, HubSpot and dozens of others, HighLevel is the stand-out winner in this space. Great product, great support and an amazing opportunity.

review_question_answers.question: What do you dislike about HighLevel?
review_question_answers.answer: The interface was a little janky when I first signed up, but they have improved it a lot over the recent months, and they are continuing to do so.

review_question_answers.question: What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
review_question_answers.answer: All in one solution that reduces technical overwhelm and expenses. It has streamlined our process, allowed us to move faster and track results more accurately.

all_reviews.review_title: HL experience is beyond any expectations
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Just everything - every single component, every feature. I am not even sure what to emphasize - contacts (smart lists!), conversations, workflows, funnels, sites, conversations (consolidation of all business communication), etc.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
I only dislike the fact that I didn't discover HL a couple of years back. After some thought, I can come up with some minor complaints - for example, calendars don't have overlapping appointment settings, but all the complaints are pretty minor relative to the great features and tremendous benefits HL provides.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
HL is solving ALL marketing and organizational problems of small businesses. Using HL is really transformational for business. Obviously, implementing HL is painful (because people hate changes, regardless of how beneficial they are), and takes time, but it takes business to a new level, without any doubts.

all_reviews.review_title: Highlevel is an All-In-One Marketing Genius Platform!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
Highlevel is absolutely amazing! It allows a small business to utilize one platform to: create a website, create landing pages, schedule clients, email clients, text clients, send broadcast emails and texts to contact list, track KPIs with new leads, create social media content 1 time to share on all social media platforms simultaneously, integrates with Google calendar, integrates with Stripe, integrates with Facebook for ads, integrates with Google My Business, integrates with Twilio, integrates with Mailgun, integrates with Shopify for an online store, creates triggers and workflows so when clients opt-in from a website page or landing page then they will automatically receive their next step. Highlevel is a gamechanger for website design, automation, and lead generation!

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
The downside to Highlevel is the learning curve to utilize all of its capabilities. However, it is also super user-friendly. I have absolutely no tech background. With the help of their tutorial videos and their YouTube channel, I was able to design my own website with drop and drag - no code required! I also created landing pages and opt-in forms for lead generation. I manage all my content marketing through their social media calendar. Even though there is a learning curve that takes a bit of time, other platforms are way less user friendly. And if you really get in a jam, their customer support is super responsive!

The only thing I wish Highlevel offered was an EHR! As a solopreneur health care provider, it would be fantastic if I could use Highlevel for my SOAP notes. Fortunately, Highlevel also integrates with my current EHR calendar so I don't have to worry about double-booking clients!

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Highlevel allows me to have one platform that does everything I need to run my in-person and virtual wellness practice. I don't have to log in to multiple platforms because Highlevel has my website, my marketing, my appointment calendar, my lead generation, and so much more!

all_reviews.review_title: The best overall marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
HighLevel provides a rich set of marketing automation tools all in one place that we can use to provide services to our digital marketing clients. The automation capabilities are powerful and allow us to create extremely useful tools for our business and for our clients to use. The ability to create HighLevel instances for our clients to use at no cost to us is amazing and very valuable to us.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
The CRM portion of the product needs significant improvement with respect to linking individual contacts who work at the same company. It also lacks the ability to send emails to contacts with cc and bcc addresses.

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
More full-featured, more robust and more well-supported than others such as ActiveCampaign, MailChimp, ClickFunnels etc.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
It allows us to create solutions and products to offer to clients that can be built by personnel on our team who are not classically trained developers.

all_reviews.review_title: Looked like a great tool, but not so much. Not yet at least
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
It's an opportunity for someone to sell it as a white-label SaaS or include as part of their own marketing bundle and have all leads and opportunities tracked in one white-labeled dashboard.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
It can take a bit to setup and get right and the email system used is only Mailgun, as far as I was told by their support, although their website also mentions Mailchimp which is much more solid email automation platform than Mailgun. Honestly, the email setup was the dealbreaker for me as I could not sell that to any current or potential future clients. They even know about the delivery issue themselves very clearly.

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
Thoroughly look through what it is exactly you want from it and what your clients would want from it. What is shown on the website as included is not all included at all. It doesn't say exactly, but their graphics eludes to it being included, yet there is additional charges.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
The benefits I was hoping to realize was that I had a lo price marketing automation product for small and micro-business clients or prospects that they could utilize and could upsell our services from there as these businesses grow. There are some features that are included that could potentially save you money.

all_reviews.review_title: HighLevel is THE must-have tool for Agencies servicing the small business community...
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
HighLevel has created an entirely new economic opportunity for Agencies selling to the small business community by developing a platform that integrates a variety of key marketing functions and empowers Agencies to deliver marketing services to their customers with the scalability and profitability that has been missing in this industry. Servicing small businesses requires a very high degree of efficiency to make the ROI work - HighLevel's technology makes it possible.

Even more important than the technology that they've developed, they've also created an outstanding culture that truly cares about the success of Agencies, and operates with incredible integrity - I've never been more impressed with the leadership of a company in my career.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
As with just about any technology startup that's trying to radically impact an industry, they develop and ship fast! This has its pros and cons, of course, so sometimes you have to operate with the expectation that new features may not be exactly what you want them to be at first. But that's a small price to pay for the innovation they are bringing to the industry.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
The problems I'm solving are:

1. Being able to integrate a variety of marketing functions without paying for or integrating a variety of marketing tools,
2. Offering services to customers at scalability and price points that previously would have been impossible,
3. Saving a lot of time and money on separate tools and headcount I would normally need to accomplish points 1 and 2 above.

all_reviews.review_title: All-In-One Marketing OS
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
It's not really just a CRM, it's more of an Operating System for marketing teams. With a super robust API and limitless customizability, it really gives you the ability to manage your system to your specifications!

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
Due to the overwhelming rush of new users in the last year, and crazy amount of new features, the support team is constantly finding themselves playing catch-up. This should be fixed with more support members getting hired this quarter! (or so I've heard)

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
Using the automated SMS, we've integrated missed-call text follow-up for hundreds of businesses, allowing the business to take advantage of new opportunity even when they're not at the office! They can either respond with their personal device via the white-labled mobile app, or we've even connected Ai to allow for automated conversation without human at all!

all_reviews.review_title: It's amazing - so many tools in one place!
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I love the fact that so many different tools are located in a single platform - pipleline management, calendar and scheduling, CRM, etc. I also really appreciate how much customization you have - it's virtually limitless when it comes to your pipeline stages. The ease of building triggers, email and text templates, etc. is better than any other CRM tool I've ever used.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
It is fairly technical - the learning curve is fairly involved, and sometimes what you're looking for isn't in the most obvious place.

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
Recognize that it will take you several days (or weeks!) of focused effort to get everything set up the way you want it. The build-out can take a decent amount of time, but the level of automation is highly worth it. I found it to be the best CRM out there for me as a solopreneur, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone who has the time to build it out and wants a tool that can scale with them.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
As a solopreneur, being able to streamline the number of tools I use is both a financial and efficiency necessity. From my experience over the past 6 months, High Level has the capability of working with me right now and growing with me for the foreseeable future.

all_reviews.review_title: We left HighLevel
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
We really liked the Facebook integration and the way the forms flowed into patient opportunities. We also really liked the text automation went out when a patient did not schedule an appointment.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
We really did not like the difficulty in tracking what opportunities were won/lost. We found that we often had to intervene manually when a patient wanted to reschedule an appointment or had questions. This required us to be logged in constantly in order to monitor and manage the leads quickly. We also did not like the fact that we could not use our pre-existing phone number as the number attached to our HighLevel account.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
We solved the bulk of patients who did not like speaking on the phone or didn't have time to call us to schedule a new appointment.

Where do I start? I LOVE this software and the development team behind it. It is the true all-in-one that I have been looking for.  All the features I need for Agency are included and get better and better every day. The dev team continuously adds new and/or upgraded features each week. I think what I love the most is the company behind the software. Never have I had such great support. The dev team as well as the management team actually listen to us. They care about our success. It's amazing!

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
That's it's no longer a secret! When I started with them, it was very early on and no one had heard of it. Now, the news is spreading among marketing agencies.  We've introduced it to many agencies ourselves.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
We have automated our entire sales and marketing systems for our agencies and for our clients. My calendar is full with qualified appointments, our onboarding process is smooth and successful. It has transformed our company and I love watching our clients do the same in their businesses.

all_reviews.review_title: Awful customer support. Not easy set up as promised.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
I like that the product has many features and is priced fairly.  I signed up as an affiliate, and recommended the platform to a client who trusted me and signed up as a user. That client is now very disappointed in the time and money wasted trying to make it work. After this experience, I will not feel comfortable recommending Go High Level again.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
I really, really wanted to use and love Go High Level. A very bad experience is forcing our company to find something else. The promotion for the product touts easy setup, but this is not true in our case. Multiple team members, including our I.T. department attempted to integrate our email after watching the training video and following instructions. After contacting customer service through their web chat (which we learned was a team member from the sales department) we were told "well - you can just buy the "done for you" set up for $299.  After 10 days of trying and back and forth messages with the support team who kept telling us "it should be fixed now", the problem still existed. Our issue was finally escalated and they offered us a Zoom meeting - but didn't have any appointments for 2 business days. Today was that day. They no-showed for the meeting.

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
I cannot recommend it.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
None, because we are unable to use it.  We wanted to use it for CRM, automation, pipeline and more. Unfortunately, we need to choose another product and no one at Go High Level seems to care.

all_reviews.review_title: Extremely well though out marketing automation platform
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
We've gone through several different types of marketing automation software like this, and this platform has everything we need and more! The system is exceptionally robust with features for:
- Conversational automation through any channel of communication you can think of: email, MMS, voicemail drops, Facebook messenger, website chat, tasks, reminders, manual sms, phone calls
- Integrations with Google my business and Facebook business page create an incredible holistic approach

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
Adding a dynamic field to a user profile isn't possible. For example, if you have an office of 3 people and each of them has a different license number, you can't add a field to their profile to identify
Workflows and Campaigns require triggers and setting up a cohesive campaign with multiple scenarios can get quite cumbersome. There are many steps involved in updating and deploying to sub-accounts, so you have to be extremely diligent in completing every step to ensure you don't miss anything.
Speed to update workflows and emails can lag behind a bit

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
Definitely sign up for their 14-day free trial and dedicate time to watching all of the support videos and getting familiar with the system. After 14 days of checking out all of the features, you will have a great idea of whether it is right for you.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
We've had to use multiple platforms for lead gen process, High Level is an all-in-one tool for the complete sales cycle: creating funnels, automatically contacting leads, tracking pipeline movement, setting appointments and tracking results.

all_reviews.review_title: Great features, steep learning curve, and it's worth it.
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about HighLevel?
A Great foundation to build on top of with a functional CRM, Website designer, funnel builder, pipeline creator, and client conversations flow. Founded, built, run, and maintained by a small group of motivated entrepreneurs, they are still closer to the beginning than what I would consider v 1.0. It's a sturdy, well build frame of a house, and you're given all the materials you need to build your dream home. But there's no inventory list or directions other than update videos and testimonials on their YouTube account. Don't go in to this without at least basic web-based coding knowledge, and prior CRM and client campaigns creation. Only a few natively integrated External services, but connects well through Zapier.

What do you dislike about HighLevel?
After being frustrated with the lack of documentation, and being told, "You can make it do that." I realized what I was being guided toward the "Triggers" tab. This tab specifically is where the lack of documentation and truly good, but difficult to grab for an extended period of time. Having an involved account manager for the first few weeks would have been nice. I'd used Hubspot CRM and Agencybloc before, so I was familiar with how aCRM and automated messages campaigns SHOULD work, I was able to use triggers and tags to build it in to what ours is today. There are no notification of system

Recommendations to others considering HighLevel:
If you want to get in on the ground floor with a new company, these guys are it. They're the leader in this wave of this industry. If you don't have time for a learning curve, don't do it. If you want the freedom to make your CRM do whatever you want, get this.

What problems is HighLevel solving and how is that benefiting you?
The ability to automate text, email, FB Messenger, and call campaigns is Paramount. It has increased our rate of contact per lead returned to OVER 50%!
